you can do a reverse connection
I'd suggest nx or vnc reverse connection to home
its not a very good fix but would give you a graphical remote desktop
it means the system behind the firewall connects outside to the other system
rather than you connecting into the server the server connects to the client
how hard is to set up nx or vnc reverse to set up ? i need to run one only one program in vista from ubuntu thats all

try this http://www.nomachine.com/ just set the vista machine as server and have it connect out to you every 10-20  minutes or so then you run the client at home and get a nicely compressed remote desktop

the only problem is if your ip changes but if on the client side at home you install this other app it reports to a static site online what your ip is so the server connects to that server to see where you are
